meanings.definition: A party where a large amount of beer is served.
meanings.sent1: Last weekend, we had a kegger in the backyard to celebrate my birthday.
meanings.sent2: The college students organized a kegger in the dormitory common room.
meanings.sent3: At the kegger, everyone was dancing and having a great time.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood block party turned into a kegger as more people arrived.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere at the kegger was lively and full of laughter.

meanings.definition: A container used to hold beer, typically a keg.
meanings.sent1: The bartender rolled out a kegger to refill the taps at the bar.
meanings.sent2: The brewery ordered a new kegger to store their latest batch of craft beer.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy kegger was a challenge for the delivery person.
meanings.sent4: The backyard BBQ featured a shiny kegger filled with cold beer.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tapping the kegger echoed through the party.

meanings.definition: A person who attends or hosts keg parties.
meanings.sent1: As a seasoned kegger, he knew all the best spots for parties in town.
meanings.sent2: The enthusiastic kegger invited friends over for a spontaneous gathering.
meanings.sent3: The dedicated kegger always made sure the beer was flowing at the party.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the ultimate kegger among her social circle.
meanings.sent5: The friendly kegger welcomed newcomers to the event with a smile.
